entry.et: Middle English, partly from past participle of weten to wet & partly from Old English wǣt wet; akin to Old Norse vātr wet, Old English wæter water

def.dt: :consisting of, containing, covered with, or soaked with liquid (as water)
:containing appreciable quantities of readily condensable hydrocarbons
:rainy wet weather
:still moist enough to smudge or smear wet paint
:drunk 1a a wet driver
:having or advocating a policy permitting the manufacture and sale of alcoholic beverages a wet county a wet candidate
:preserved in liquid
:employing or done by means of or in the presence of water or other liquid wet extraction of copper
:overly sentimental
:lacking strength of character :weak spineless
:belonging to the moderate or liberal wing of the Conservative party
:completely wrong :in error
:immature inexperienced

entry.pt: wet damp dank moist humid mean covered or more or less soaked with liquid. wet usually implies saturation but may suggest a covering of a surface with water or something (as paint) not yet dry slipped on the wet pavement. damp implies a slight or moderate absorption and often connotes an unpleasant degree of moisture clothes will mildew if stored in a damp place. dank implies a more distinctly disagreeable or unwholesome dampness a prisoner in a cold, dank cell. moist applies to what is slightly damp or not felt as dry treat the injury with moist heat. humid applies to the presence of much water vapor in the air a hot, humid climate.

def.dt: :water
:moisture wetness
:rainy weather :rain
:an advocate of a policy of permitting the sale of intoxicating liquors
:one who is wet

entry.et: Middle English weten, from Old English wǣtan, from wǣt, adjective

def.dt: :to make wet
:to urinate in or on wet his pants
:to become wet
:urinate
:to take a drink especially of liquor
:a bar for mixing drinks (as in a home) that contains a sink with running water
:one that quenches or dampens enthusiasm or pleasure
:to dampen by sprinkling with water
:an erotic dream culminating in orgasm and in the male accompanied by ejaculation of semen
:an exceedingly pleasurable or exciting experience, situation, or fantasy
:a woman who cares for and suckles children not her own
:to act as wet nurse to
:to give constant and often excessive care to
:a close-fitting suit made of material (as sponge rubber) that is worn (as by a skin diver) especially in cold water to retain body heat and that traps a thin layer of water against the body
